text: [Music]
hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I'm going to
show you how to make my 20 minute
chicken rice soup it's so simple now I
know I make simple recipes but this is
like ridiculously easy and simple a
blindfolded monkey can make this recipe
it's that easy so before we get started
let's go read ingredients you're gonna
need some good-quality chicken broth
some fresh baby spinach some cooked
chicken that I just shredded a little
bit of ice some lemon parsley salt and
pepper now I told you this was easy
there's not going to be no sauteing
nothing it's just pretty much everything
in a pot it cooks itself in 20 minutes
to prepare dinner now yesterday I made a
whole roast chicken now I love a whole
roast chicken I love it when I have it
for company because it serves a lot of
people and it's a very easy thing to
make but I love roast chicken when it's
just my husband and I I make a whole six
pound roast chicken because we can have
a great roast dinner that night and I
have chicken in the fridge to use up for
a few days so with the white meat I
usually make like a chicken salad or I
like to eat it like in wrap or something
but with a dark meat I always do like a
soup with it so it's like you come home
from dinner you're coming from work do
you want dinner you don't have time so
this is the thing to make and it's I had
the stove on and on an arm Doudna and it
takes no time at all
so in this pot all I'm going to to its
put in my chicken broth and you want to
make sure you use a good quality chicken
broth and all I'm gonna do is let that
come up to a boil and once it comes up
to a boil we'll add pretty much
everything else my chicken stock is up
to a boil so now I'm going to add in my
rice and my chicken my chicken like I
said it's already cooked so I just
shredded the dark meat and I'm gonna put
it right in here it's that simple and
easy and I'm going to season it with
some salt and pepper now when you buy
chicken stock at the store make sure you
buy the Kanna says low sodium or reduce
sodium definitely have a lot less salt
which means you can
you know you can you're in charge of how
salty you like your food because
otherwise it can be some of some kinds
can be so overwhelmingly salty it's
unbelievable so buy one that's always
reduced sodium or low sodium and all I'm
going to do is let this cook for about
ten minutes or so or until the rice is
completely cooked my soups been cooking
for about ten minutes since I put in the
rice and the chicken the rice is back
cooked through because I mean depending
on the kind of rice you use mine takes
about ten minutes to cook now to this
I'm going to add in my spinach and if
you don't have fresh spinach on hand use
frozen spinach or don't use spinach at
all use whatever you have leftover this
is why you know this is the kind of soup
that you can just throw together with
whatever you got if you got some cooked
potatoes come up put them in there if
you have some cooked up veggies put them
in there oh and judge you I don't care
that's what I do it's going to turn that
off because the spinach just needs to
wilt and already has I'm going to finish
it with some fresh parsley and because I
love I kind of like refreshing taste I'm
going to put in a little bit of lemon
zest and the juice of a whole lemon it
really kind of brings the soup to a
whole new level and it makes it taste
bit more interesting with a fresher bit
new word you know which I like that but
if you don't like it you don't have to
add it if you don't have parsley don't
add parsley again it's one of those

going to juice the whole thing in here
last bit of the lemon give this a long

ladle up so excited you know I love

all delicious smells even better mmm
